title: No, Kim Jong-un has not warned the people who are conspiring to kill Modi
subtitle: Kim Jong-un has not warned the people who are conspiring to kill Modi. No credible newspaper have published about these statements by Kim Jong-un
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A photo of a news article is being shared widely on social media with a claim that the North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has warned the people who are conspiring to kill Narendra Modi. Let’s try to analyze the claim made in the post. 



Claim: Kim Jong-un has warned the people who are conspiring to kill Narendra Modi. Fact: The news article in the ‘janta se rishata’ website gives information credit to ‘orientaltimes.in’, whose domain is expired now. Also, no credible news source was found to have published about these statements by Kim Jong-un. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE.

In the photo, it can be seen that the article was published on the ‘janta se rishata’ website. On the website, it can be found that the information credit for the article was given to ‘orientaltimes.in’. But, that website domain is expired now. On the Twitter handle of ‘Oriental Times India’, it can be seen that they have published similar articles that Kim Jong-un has commented praising Modi. But, when searched on Google for comments by Kim Jong-un on Modi, it was found that no credible news agency has published anything about Kim Jong-un commenting on Modi.

To sum it up, Kim Jong-un has not warned the people who are conspiring to kill Modi.
